booking.title: Why Book With Us
booking.subtitle: We are committed to understanding your unique needs and delivering care.
booking.description: As a trusted healthcare provider in our community, we are passionate about promoting health and wellness beyond the clinic. We actively engage in community outreach programs, health fairs, and educational workshop.
booking.vision_text: We envision a community where everyone has access to high-quality healthcare and the resources they need to lead healthy, fulfilling lives.
booking.mission_text: We aim to revolutionize healthcare delivery by connecting patients with qualified healthcare professionals.
booking.search_doctors_desc: Search for a doctor based on specialization, location, or availability for your Treatements
booking.check_profile_desc: Explore detailed doctor profiles on our platform to make informed healthcare decisions.
booking.schedule_desc: After choose your preferred doctor, select a convenient time slot, & confirm your appointment.
booking.get_solution_desc: Discuss your health concerns with the doctor and receive the personalized advice & with solution.

faqs.title: Your Questions are Answered
faqs.q1: How do I book an appointment with a doctor?
faqs.a1: Yes, simply visit our website and log in or create an account. Search for a doctor based on specialization, location, or availability & confirm your booking.
faqs.q2: Can I request a specific doctor when booking my appointment?
faqs.a2: Yes, you can usually request a specific doctor when booking your appointment, though availability may vary based on their schedule.
faqs.q3: What should I do if I need to cancel or reschedule my appointment?
faqs.a3: If you need to cancel or reschedule your appointment, contact the doctor as soon as possible to inform them and to reschedule for another available time slot.
faqs.q4: What if I'm running late for my appointment?
faqs.a4: If you know you will be late, it's courteous to call the doctor's office and inform them. Depending on their policy and schedule, they may be able to accommodate you or reschedule your appointment.
faqs.q5: Can I book appointments for family members or dependents?
faqs.a5: Yes, in many cases, you can book appointments for family members or dependents. However, you may need to provide their personal information and consent to do so.

terms.title: Terms & Conditions
terms.intro_description: Terms governing use of Anees Healthcare Platform services in Egypt.
terms.intro_paragraph_1: Welcome to Anees Healthcare Platform, your trusted partner for professional home healthcare and telemedicine services in Egypt. By accessing or using our platform, you agree to be bound by these Terms and Conditions. Please read them carefully before using our services.
terms.intro_paragraph_2: These Terms govern your use of our platform and services, including home nursing care, physician home visits, physiotherapy, laboratory services, telemedicine consultations, and medical equipment rental. Our services comply with Egyptian Ministry of Health and Population (MoHP) regulations, Law No. 198 of 2020 on Healthcare Services, and the Egyptian Medical Syndicate ethical guidelines.
terms.section_1_item_1: "Platform" refers to the Anees Healthcare website, mobile applications, and all related services
terms.section_1_item_2: "Services" include home healthcare visits, telemedicine consultations, medical equipment rental, and related offerings
terms.section_1_item_3: "Healthcare Providers" are licensed physicians, nurses, physiotherapists, and medical professionals on our platform
terms.section_1_item_4: "Patient" or "User" refers to individuals using our platform to access healthcare services
terms.section_1_item_5: "Home Healthcare" encompasses medical services delivered at the patient's residence
terms.section_2_item_1: Age Requirement: You must be at least 18 years old to create an account. For minors, a parent or legal guardian must create and manage the account
terms.section_2_item_2: Identity Verification: You must provide accurate personal information, including national ID or passport number, as required by Egyptian healthcare regulations
terms.section_2_item_3: Account Security: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your login credentials
terms.section_2_item_4: Prohibited Use: You may not use another person's account or provide false information
terms.section_2_item_5: Account Termination: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate accounts that violate these Terms
terms.section_3_1_intro: We facilitate the following home-based medical services:
terms.section_3_1_item_1: Home nursing care (wound care, medication administration, catheter management)
terms.section_3_1_item_2: Physician home visits for medical consultations and examinations
terms.section_3_1_item_4: Home laboratory services (blood tests, sample collection)
terms.section_3_1_item_5: Medical equipment rental (oxygen concentrators, hospital beds, wheelchairs)
terms.section_3_1_item_6: Elderly care and chronic disease management
terms.section_3_2_note: Telemedicine is NOT suitable for medical emergencies. Call 123 (Egyptian Emergency Services) for urgent care.
terms.section_4_item_1: Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are subject to healthcare provider availability and confirmed in real-time
terms.section_4_item_2: Appointment Times: Home visits are scheduled within agreed time windows (2-4 hours). Late arrivals beyond 30 minutes qualify for service credits
terms.section_4_item_3: Patient Responsibilities: Ensure accurate address details, availability at scheduled time, and safe access for healthcare providers
terms.section_4_cancellation_item_1: Free cancellation up to 6 hours before scheduled appointment
terms.section_4_cancellation_item_2: 50% cancellation fee for cancellations 2-6 hours before appointment
terms.section_4_cancellation_item_3: Full charge for cancellations less than 2 hours before appointment or no-shows
terms.section_4_item_5: Rescheduling: Appointments can be rescheduled once without penalty (subject to availability)
terms.section_4_item_6: Emergency Bookings: Same-day urgent visits may incur additional fees (20-30% surcharge)
terms.section_5_item_1: Accepted Payment Methods: Credit/debit cards (Visa, Mastercard), mobile wallets (Vodafone Cash, Fawry), cash on delivery, and insurance (select providers)
terms.section_5_item_2: Pricing: All fees are displayed in Egyptian Pounds (EGP) before booking confirmation. Prices include VAT (14%) as per Egyptian tax law
terms.section_5_item_3: Service Fees: Platform service fee (10-15%) is included in displayed prices
terms.section_5_additional_item_3: Remote areas outside Cairo/Giza/Alexandria: Transportation fees
terms.section_5_additional_item_4: Medical supplies and medications (billed separately at cost + 10%)
terms.section_5_item_5: Insurance Claims: We assist with insurance documentation, but patients are responsible for pre-authorization and claim submissions
terms.section_5_item_6: Refund Policy: Full refunds for canceled services by providers. No refunds for completed services unless severe quality issues are verified
terms.section_6_intro: All healthcare providers on our platform are:
terms.section_6_item_1: Licensed by the Egyptian Medical Syndicate, Nursing Syndicate, or relevant professional bodies
terms.section_6_item_2: Verified through background checks and credential verification
terms.section_6_item_3: Insured for professional liability (minimum EGP 1,000,000 coverage)
terms.section_6_item_4: Required to maintain continuing medical education (CME) credits
terms.section_6_item_5: Subject to patient reviews and quality monitoring
terms.section_6_provider_independence: Provider Independence: Healthcare providers are independent contractors, not employees of Anees Healthcare Platform.
terms.section_7_item_1: Platform Role: Anees is a technology platform connecting patients with healthcare providers. We do NOT provide medical advice or treatment directly
terms.section_7_item_2: No Guarantees: We do not guarantee specific medical outcomes or diagnoses. Healthcare providers are solely responsible for their clinical decisions
terms.section_7_item_3: Emergency Situations: Our services are NOT for medical emergencies. For life-threatening conditions, call 123 or visit the nearest emergency room
terms.section_7_item_4: Telemedicine Limitations: Some conditions require in-person examination. Providers may refuse telemedicine consultations when physical examination is necessary
terms.section_7_item_5: Prescription Validity: E-prescriptions issued via telemedicine are valid for 30 days and comply with Egyptian Pharmacists Syndicate regulations
terms.section_7_item_6: Laboratory Results: Lab results are for informational purposes and should be interpreted by qualified physicians
terms.section_8_item_1: Provider Liability: Healthcare providers are solely responsible for medical malpractice, negligence, or errors in treatment
terms.section_8_item_2: Platform Liability: Anees is liable only for technical platform failures preventing service delivery (limited to service fee refund)
terms.section_8_item_3: Maximum Liability: Our total liability is limited to the amount paid for the specific service in question
terms.section_8_item_4_title: Patient Indemnification: Patients agree to indemnify Anees against claims arising from:
terms.section_8_indemn_item_1: Providing false or misleading health information
terms.section_8_indemn_item_4: Damage to healthcare provider equipment or property
terms.section_8_item_5: Force Majeure: We are not liable for service interruptions due to natural disasters, government restrictions, or events beyond our control
terms.section_9_1_item_1: Receive safe, competent, and respectful healthcare services
terms.section_9_1_item_2: Access your medical records within 72 hours of request
terms.section_9_1_item_3: Receive treatment without discrimination based on gender, religion, nationality, or disability
terms.section_9_1_item_4: Informed consent before any medical procedure
terms.section_9_1_item_5: Privacy and confidentiality of medical information
terms.section_9_1_item_6: File complaints about service quality or provider conduct
terms.section_9_1_item_7: Second medical opinions from different providers
terms.section_9_2_item_1: Provide accurate medical history and current medications
terms.section_9_2_item_2: Inform providers of allergies and adverse reactions
terms.section_9_2_item_3: Follow prescribed treatment plans and medical advice
terms.section_9_2_item_4: Respect healthcare providers and maintain appropriate conduct
terms.section_9_2_item_6: Maintain a safe environment for home healthcare visits
terms.section_10_item_1: All platform content, logos, trademarks, and software are owned by Anees Healthcare or licensed to us
terms.section_10_item_2: You may not reproduce, distribute, or create derivative works without written permission
terms.section_10_item_3: Patient reviews and feedback become our property upon submission
terms.section_10_item_4: Medical records remain the property of patients, with platform having limited access for service delivery
terms.section_11_intro_1: Your privacy is governed by our
terms.section_11_intro_2: , which complies with Egyptian Data Protection Law No. 151/2019 and healthcare privacy regulations. Key points:
terms.section_11_item_1: Medical data is encrypted and stored securely
terms.section_11_item_2: Information is shared only with treating healthcare providers and authorized parties
terms.section_11_item_3: You have rights to access, correct, and request deletion of your data (subject to legal retention requirements)
terms.section_11_item_4: We never sell your medical information to third parties
terms.section_12_item_1: Filing Complaints: Submit complaints via email to complaints@aneeshealthcare.eg or through the platform within 14 days of service
terms.section_12_item_2: Resolution Process: We investigate complaints within 7 business days and provide written responses
terms.section_12_item_3: Medical Disputes: Disputes regarding medical care may be escalated to the Egyptian Medical Syndicate Ethics Committee
terms.section_12_item_4: Arbitration: Unresolved disputes shall be settled through arbitration in Cairo, Egypt, under Egyptian Arbitration Law No. 27/1994
terms.section_12_item_5: Governing Law: These Terms are governed by the laws of the Arab Republic of Egypt
terms.section_12_item_6: Jurisdiction: Egyptian courts in Cairo have exclusive jurisdiction for legal disputes
terms.section_13_item_1: Use the platform for illegal purposes or fraudulent activities
terms.section_13_item_2: Harass, threaten, or abuse healthcare providers or platform staff
terms.section_13_item_3: Share account credentials or impersonate others
terms.section_13_item_5: Attempt to hack, disrupt, or compromise platform security
terms.section_13_item_6: Use services to obtain controlled substances without legitimate medical need
terms.section_13_item_7: Resell or commercially exploit platform services
terms.section_13_warning: Violation of these terms may result in account suspension, service termination, and legal action.
terms.section_14_intro: We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time to reflect legal changes, service updates, or operational improvements. Material changes will be communicated via email and platform notifications 30 days before taking effect. Continued use of services after changes constitutes acceptance.
terms.section_15_item_1: Geographic Coverage: Currently serving Cairo, Giza, Alexandria, and select cities (expanding coverage continuously)
terms.section_15_item_2: Operating Hours: Platform available 24/7; home services available 7am-10pm (emergency services available 24/7 in select areas)
terms.section_15_item_3: Service Interruptions: We strive for 99.9% uptime but cannot guarantee uninterrupted service
terms.section_15_item_4: Platform Updates: Periodic maintenance may temporarily affect availability (scheduled during off-peak hours)
terms.section_16_intro: For questions, support, or concerns regarding these Terms:
terms.section_16_item_5: Anees Healthcare Platform, Office Address, Cairo, Egypt
terms.section_17_item_1: Egyptian Healthcare Services Law No. 198 of 2020
terms.section_17_item_4: Ministry of Health and Population Telemedicine Guidelines (2020)
terms.important_notice_text: By clicking "I Agree" or using our services, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms & Conditions. These Terms are available in both English and Arabic. In case of discrepancy, the Arabic version shall prevail under Egyptian law.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro_paragraph_1: At Anees Healthcare Platform, we are committed to protecting your privacy and safeguarding your personal health information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and protect your information in compliance with Egyptian Data Protection Laws, the Egyptian Constitution (Article 57), and international healthcare privacy standards including GDPR principles.
privacy.intro_paragraph_2: As a home healthcare and telemedicine service provider operating in Egypt, we adhere to regulations set forth by the Egyptian Ministry of Health and Population (MoHP), the Supreme Council of Universities' medical ethics guidelines, and Law No. 151 of 2019 concerning cybersecurity and personal data protection.
privacy.intro_description: Learn how Anees Healthcare Platform protects your privacy and personal health information in compliance with Egyptian and international data protection standards.
privacy.section_1_1_item_1: Full name, national ID number (as required by Egyptian MoHP regulations)
privacy.section_1_1_item_2: Date of birth, gender, contact details (phone, email, address)
privacy.section_1_2_item_1: Medical history, current medications, and allergies
privacy.section_1_2_item_2: Lab results, diagnostic reports, and imaging records
privacy.section_1_2_item_4: Home healthcare visit records and vital signs monitoring data
privacy.section_1_2_item_5: Telemedicine consultation recordings (with explicit consent as per Egyptian law)
privacy.section_1_3_item_1: Device information, IP addresses, and browser types
privacy.section_1_3_item_2: Location data for home healthcare service delivery
privacy.section_1_3_item_3: Platform usage data and appointment history
privacy.section_2_intro: We use your information for the following purposes, all in compliance with Egyptian healthcare regulations:
privacy.section_2_item_1_text: Scheduling appointments, coordinating home visits, facilitating telemedicine consultations
privacy.section_2_item_2_text: Maintaining electronic health records (EHR) as required by MoHP digitalization initiatives
privacy.section_2_item_3_text: Sharing information with licensed healthcare providers for continuity of care
privacy.section_2_item_4_text: Monitoring service quality and healthcare provider performance
privacy.section_2_item_5_text: Meeting Egyptian Ministry of Health reporting requirements and legal obligations
privacy.section_2_item_6_text: Providing critical information to emergency medical services when necessary
privacy.section_2_item_7_text: Anonymized data analysis for healthcare improvement (only with explicit consent)
privacy.section_3_intro: We implement comprehensive security measures in accordance with Egyptian cybersecurity laws and international healthcare data standards:
privacy.section_3_item_1_text: End-to-end encryption for all medical data transmission (AES-256 standard)
privacy.section_3_item_2_text: Role-based access with multi-factor authentication for healthcare providers
privacy.section_3_item_3_text: Healthcare data stored on Egyptian-based or EU-compliant servers with regular security audits
privacy.section_3_item_4_text: All personnel undergo mandatory data protection and medical confidentiality training
privacy.section_3_item_5_text: Established protocols for data breach notification as per Egyptian law (within 72 hours)
privacy.section_3_item_6_text: Complete logs of all access to medical records for accountability
privacy.section_4_intro: We share your information only in specific, legally-compliant circumstances:
privacy.section_4_item_1_text: Licensed physicians, nurses, and medical professionals on our platform for treatment purposes
privacy.section_4_item_2_text: Hospitals, laboratories, and pharmacies for coordinated care (with consent)
privacy.section_4_item_3_text: Egyptian Ministry of Health, law enforcement, or courts when legally required
privacy.section_4_item_4_text: Emergency medical responders when patient safety is at risk
privacy.section_4_item_5_text: Vetted third-party vendors (payment processors, cloud storage) under strict confidentiality agreements
privacy.section_4_item_6_text: Only with explicit written consent for claims processing
privacy.section_4_never_sell: We NEVER sell your medical information to third parties.
privacy.section_5_intro: In accordance with Egyptian Constitution Article 57 and Data Protection Law No. 151/2019, you have the following rights:
privacy.section_5_item_1_text: Request copies of your medical records at any time
privacy.section_5_item_2_text: Request corrections to inaccurate health information
privacy.section_5_item_3_text: Request deletion of data (subject to legal retention requirements for medical records - typically 20 years in Egypt)
privacy.section_5_item_4_text: Receive your health data in a transferable electronic format
privacy.section_5_item_5_text: Object to processing of your data for research or marketing purposes
privacy.section_5_item_6_text: Withdraw consent for telemedicine recording or data analysis (prospectively)
privacy.section_5_item_7_text: Lodge complaints with the Egyptian Data Protection Authority
privacy.section_5_contact_text: To exercise any of these rights, contact us at
privacy.section_6_intro: We retain your information in accordance with Egyptian medical record-keeping regulations:
privacy.section_6_item_1_text: Minimum 20 years from last treatment (as per MoHP guidelines)
privacy.section_6_item_2_text: 10 years for tax and accounting compliance
privacy.section_6_item_4_text: Until consent is withdrawn or account closure
privacy.section_7_intro: For patients under 18 years of age, we require parental or legal guardian consent for all medical services and data processing, in accordance with Egyptian civil law. Parents have the right to access, correct, and request deletion of their children's health information.
privacy.section_8_intro: For telemedicine consultations conducted via our platform:
privacy.section_8_item_1: Video/audio consultations may be recorded ONLY with explicit patient consent
privacy.section_8_item_2: All recordings are encrypted and stored securely with access limited to treating physicians
privacy.section_8_item_3: Patients can request deletion of consultation recordings after treatment completion
privacy.section_8_item_4: Telemedicine services comply with Egyptian MoHP telemedicine guidelines issued in 2020
privacy.section_9_intro: If we transfer data outside Egypt (e.g., for cloud storage or specialized medical consultations), we ensure:
privacy.section_9_item_1: Transfers only to countries with adequate data protection laws (EU, EEA, approved jurisdictions)
privacy.section_9_item_2: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) or equivalent safeguards
privacy.section_9_item_3: Explicit patient consent for international medical second opinions
privacy.section_10_intro: We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in Egyptian laws, regulations, or our practices. Material changes will be communicated via email and prominently displayed on our platform 30 days before taking effect. Continued use of our services after changes constitutes acceptance.
privacy.section_11_intro: For privacy-related questions, concerns, or to exercise your rights:
privacy.section_12_item_2: Egyptian Data Protection Law No. 151 of 2019
privacy.section_12_item_3: Egyptian Ministry of Health and Population Regulations
privacy.section_12_item_6: GDPR Principles (where applicable for EU citizens)
privacy.important_text: This privacy policy is provided in both English and Arabic. In case of any discrepancy, the Arabic version shall prevail in accordance with Egyptian law.
